DOC.brief_summary: To improve the treatment outcome in patients with tuberculosis and integrate the pharmacogenetics into clinical practice, the information of NAT2 genotyping was used in re-challenge protocol for isoniazid (INH) titration in patients with anti-tuberculosis medication-induced hepatitis.
DOC.brief_title: NAT2 Genotyping in Re-challenge Protocol of INH Titration in Patients With Anti-TB Medications-induced Hepatitis
DOC.criteria: 1. >= 18 years. 2. Take INH for at least a week. 3. abnormal liver function (ALT (alanine, transaminase) increased by more than three times the upper limit of normal, or ALT higher than twice the upper limit of normal and total bilirubin higher than 2.0 mg / dL 1.Taking INH before liver function abnormalities. 2.
